WorkItem.Description:
Working with a friend, she said that Rawr was recommending some weird things, like Str/Crit in sockets that were not matching socket bonuses.  When I tried to take a look, a number of weird things happened:  If I equipped another gemming in the boots, even one that showed a lower DPS than the currently equipped Str/Crit in both sockets, the same gemming appeared to still be equipped, but the numbers in the entire list would still change.  When running an Optimize, it once showed only one item in the left (old) column, the helm, and nothing in the right, not even a new DPS score.
 
I wish I could be more helpful, but it's just all-around weird.  Play with it a little while, and see if you can reproduce some of what I mentioned.
 
This is under Rawr3.

Comments.Message: No clue what the rest of that meant but one thing I can answer is that you don't have to gem to meet socket bonuses... in many cases in fact it's actually detrimental to your score.
If Rawr appears to make odd gem choices it is often due to Rawr ensuring that the metagem criteria are met as well

Please attach both character files (before and after optimize) so we can manually compare if there are any differences.
and please read the documentation, especially the section labeled "I Don't Understand Why..."
Jothay, it's me.  Really?  Really.  And, this is after an Optimize.  That's what's so weird.  This is the profile as she gave it to me, so it's after the Optimize she ran.
Also, if you notice, "Enforce Meta Requirements" is in fact enabled.

And the "odd gem choices" go far beyond satisfying meta requirements; It goes almost straight Str/Crit, as much as possible.  I do not agree with this from a theory/knowledge PoV.  Give me some credit here. :P
I swear, I'm not reading this stuff as thoroughly as I think I am lately... sorry brwarner
Does this problem persist in the current Rawr3? Astry posted a new version recently.
